SNORT live scenario 2 

sudo snort -v -l . 

sudo snort -r snort.log.1746386726 -X -n 50 | grep 4444

05/04-19:25:26.651007 10.10.196.55:54332 -> 10.10.144.156:4444
05/04-19:25:26.659654 10.10.144.156:4444 -> 10.10.196.55:54332
05/04-19:25:26.668284 10.10.144.156:4444 -> 10.10.196.55:54332

- port 4444 is used in metasploit framework and other hacking tools 

sudo gedit /etc/snort/rules/local.rules

file: 
drop tcp any 4444 <> any any (msg:"possible brute force attack"; sid:1000001; rev:1;)

-A flag mode 
sudo snort -c /etc/snort/snort.conf -q -Q --daq afpacket -i eth0:eth1 -A console

success: 
05/04-20:35:27.688638  [Drop] [**] [1:1000001:1] possible brute force attack [**] [Priority: 0] {TCP} 10.10.144.156:4444 -> 10.10.196.55:54146
05/04-20:35:27.776933  [Drop] [**] [1:1000001:1] possible brute force attack [**] [Priority: 0] {TCP} 10.10.196.55:54148 -> 10.10.144.156:4444
05/04-20:35:28.094369  [Drop] [**] [1:1000001:1] possible brute force attack [**] [Priority: 0] {TCP} 10.10.144.156:4444 -> 10.10.196.55:54150
05/04-20:35:28.118052  [Drop] [**] [1:1000001:1] possible brute force attack [**] [Priority: 0] {TCP} 10.10.144.156:4444 -> 10.10.196.55:54152
05/04-20:35:28.218218  [Drop] [**] [1:1000001:1] possible brute force attack [**] [Priority: 0] {TCP} 10.10.144.156:4444 -> 10.10.196.55:54154
05/04-20:35:28.336484  [Drop] [**] [1:1000001:1] possible brute force attack [**] [Priority: 0] {TCP} 10.10.144.156:4444 -> 10.10.196.55:54156

- full mode 
sudo snort -c /etc/snort/snort.conf -q -Q --daq afpacket -i eth0:eth1 -A full
